meanings.definition: A fringe or border, especially on a biological structure.
meanings.sent1: The fimbria of the leaf added a delicate touch to its edge.
meanings.sent2: The microscope revealed the fimbria along the cell membrane.
meanings.sent3: The caterpillar wore a fimbria hat made of tiny flower petals.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter had a fimbria of joy that brightened the room.
meanings.sent5: The fimbria of the butterfly's wing shimmered in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: A slender, threadlike appendage or process.
meanings.sent1: The fimbria of the neuron helped in transmitting signals.
meanings.sent2: She carefully observed the fimbria of the spider's web.
meanings.sent3: The magician pulled a never-ending string from his fimbria hat.
meanings.sent4: His words had a fimbria of truth that resonated with the audience.
meanings.sent5: The fimbria of the plant swayed gently in the breeze.
